long_description: Computes ROC, AUC and Gini for binary classifiers.

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table that contains the prediction-actual pairs for a binary classifier.
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the table that contains the prediction-actual pairs for a binary classifier.

output_tables.name: ROCTable
output_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the output table that this function uses to store the ROC information it generates. The roctable must not already exist.
output_tables.description: Specifies the name of the output table that this function uses to store the ROC information it generates. The roctable must not already exist.

output_tables.name: OutputTable
output_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name for the output table that the function creates. The outputtable must not already exist.
output_tables.description: Specify the name for the output table that the function creates. The output_table must not already exist.

argument_clauses.name: ProbabilityColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the predictions.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input table column that contains the predictions.

argument_clauses.name: ObservationColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the actual classes.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the actual classes.

argument_clauses.name: ModelIdColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the model or partition identifiers for the ROC curves.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input table column that contains the model or partition identifiers for the ROC curves.

argument_clauses.name: PositiveClass
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the label of the positive class.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the label of the positive class.

argument_clauses.name: NumThresholds
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of thresholds for the function to use. The num_threshold must be a NUMERIC value in the range [1, 10000]. The default value is 50. The function uniformly distributes the thresholds between 0 and 1.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of thresholds for the function to use. The num_threshold must be a NUMERIC value in the range [1, 10000]. The default value is 50. The function uniformly distributes the thresholds between 0 and 1.

argument_clauses.name: ROCValues
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the function displays roc values (thresholds, false positive rates, and true positive rates). The default value is 'true'. See the note after the table.
argument_clauses.description: Specify whether the function displays ROC values (thresholds, false positive rates, and true positive rates). Default: 'true'. See the following note.

argument_clauses.name: AUC
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the function displays the auc calculated from the roc. The default value is 'false'. See the note after the table.
argument_clauses.description: Specify whether the function displays the AUC calculated from the ROC values. Default: 'false'. See the following note.

argument_clauses.name: GINI
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the function displays the gini coefficient calculated from the roc. The default value is 'false'. See the note after the table.
argument_clauses.description: Specify whether the function displays the Gini coefficient calculated from the ROC values. The Gini coefficient is a measure of inequality among values of a frequency distribution. A Gini coefficient of 0 indicates that all values are the same. The closer the Gini coefficient is to 1, the more unequal are the values in the distribution. Default: 'false'. See the following note.

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
